divs: sighting detailswe had gotten done with trick-or-treating around 8:30 pm est in kennesaw, ga, and had left our neighbor's house (they were still standing outside talking). i went inside and started to close some curtains and noticed a red fireball\star-like ball of light that was crossing the sky (from southwest to northeast) over the neighborhood (i'm guessing about a quarter-mile to a half-mile up). it was bright, and looked rather weird, so i went outside to see it better (thinking at that time it was likely just a plane). the neighbors were all looking up at it too (we exchanged a few "what is that?" type phrases). it only took about 2-3 minutes to cross overhead. it moved about as fast as i've seen helicopters move, but the fact it was just one bright light made it look odd. i didn't have time to grab a camera. i actually wasn't going to report it at all due to the lack of a photo and the fact it's path\speed resembled a helicopter or plane; however, i saw another report in ga of a very similarly-described red light in the sky that same night (titled "star like redish light tranformed to a flarelike fire ball" submitted on 11-1-2010), and perhaps these "cases" are linked. i can provide a map of it's approximate path, if needed.
trends: There have been 7 other sightings in Kennesaw
There were no other sightings in Kennesaw on or around October 31st 2010
Summary: Bright red fireball/light passes over residential area
